sources.title: Autumn Sonata
sources.description:
A romance film about first love, unforgettable yet so inappropriate at the moment.
Ilya and Sasha loved each other in their youth but then broke up. Years have passed, Ilya is married, Sasha is divorced. Family life didn’t work out for either of them. But now they find themselves together again, and they try to correct the mistakes of their youth at a small remote station. 
They have the whole of eight days...

Year of production: 1974

Written and directed by: Andrey Smirnov
Director of photography: Alexander Knyazhinsky
Music: Alfred Schnittke
Production designer: Alexander Boim
Starring: Natalia Rudnaya, Leonid Kulagin, Natalya Gundareva, Aleksandr Fatyushin, Lyudmila Maksakova, Armen Dzhigarkhanyan

metadata.Plot: After having neglected her children for many years, world famous pianist Charlotte visits her daughter Eva in her home. To her surprise she finds her other daughter, Helena, there as well. Helena is mentally disabled, and Eva has taken Helena out of the institution where their mother had placed her. The tension between Charlotte and Eva only builds up slowly, until a nightly conversation releases all the things they have wanted to tell each other.
metadata.Actors: Ingrid Bergman, Liv Ullmann, Lena Nyman
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. 10 wins & 10 nominations total
